Ideas about Themes of a Quinceanera

Every girl in Latin-America would want a special quinceanera ceremony in her life. The following are some theme ideas. Choose one for yours.
Color Theme
The color of the girl's dress has a lot of significance. Usually, a girl wears a pink dress for her Quinceañera. The color pink is supposed to be symbolic of her innocence. However, many girls now prefer to wear a white, peach or purple-colored dress as now the elegant purple prom dresses are popular. In any case, the color of dress should be of a lighter shade. You could hence give your daughter's Quinceañera a color theme. For example, if your daughter is going to wear a pink dress, then you can use pink roses to decorate the place. You can keep a bouquet of pink roses as a centerpiece for all the tables. You can use pink drapes as well. You could welcome your daughter's girl-friends with a corsage of pink flowers, while young boys could be welcomed with a pink boutonnière. The gift-wrap paper for the favors can be pink as well, and so can the icing on the cake.


Fairytale Theme
Indeed, a Quinceañera sounds like a ceremony straight out of a fairytale, so what could be a better theme for a Quinceañera than a fairytale? You can choose your daughter's favorite fairytale. If your daughter liked Cinderella as a little girl, you can have your daughter arrive in a carriage with a dress for sweet 16. You can ask your daughter's godmother to dress and look like Cinderella's Fairy Godmother. What's more, the ritual of the shoes will just complete the tale serendipitously!

Flower Theme
One simple theme for a Quinceañera will be flowers. You can either choose to decorate the venue with a single flower (for example, carnations of all different colors, or Gerberas of all different colors, etc.) or you can choose different flowers of a particular color (for example, if your daughter likes yellow flowers, you can pick yellow roses, yellow carnations, yellow dahlias, yellow narcissus, etc.). You can use flowers to make a lovely fascinator to adorn your daughter's hair as well. You could welcome your girl's girl-friends with one as well. Another idea can be to design a floral pink dress for your daughter.

Unusual Theme Ideas
Victorian Theme - Research a little bit on the fashion trends, hairstyles, and furnishing trends that were prevalent in the Victorian era and base your daughter's Quinceañera on it.
Tinker Bell - If your daughter is not too fond of the big, pompous, flattering dress that is traditionally worn for a Quinceañea, this theme will allow you to design a modern, short Quinceañera dress for your daughter; something similar to what Tinker Bell wears herself! You may get inspiration from fashion 2013 prom dresses collections.
Flamenco - A flamenco theme for your daughter's Quinceañera will give you the opportunity to design an unusual dress for her. Along with that, if you plan to have choreographed dances for the ceremony, you can choose to have a flamenco dance! It looks exotic.

Darlington Co. students’ Dress Code

Perhaps there is no other school like Darlington County School District to formulate detailed wear code for students. Let’s have a look at it.
The Darlington County School District enforces a district-wide dress code. This dress code is designed to reduce distractions, improve safety, and create a more positive educational climate for the students and the staff.
All students must follow the wear code while attending school, riding buses to and from school, and participating in school functions, unless otherwise indicated by the principal.

"A change in the wear code is one way to improve a school's climate. A wear code can help to establish a positive, focused educational environment - but only if it is enforced. We expect our administrators and teachers to enforce this policy and we expect our students to obey this policy," said Dr. Rainey Knight, Superintendent.
If a student violates the wear code, he/she will be sent home to change or a parent may bring a change of clothes to the school.
Refusal to change will result in in-school suspension and repeated violations will be considered disruptive behavior in violation of the student code of conduct.

Students who are removed from class to change clothes will be required to make up any class time they miss. The makeup time will take place after school. Parents will be responsible for paying for a certified teacher to remain and instruct the student. Failure to do so may result in a student repeating the course(s).
Dress Code Guidelines:
No exposed undergarments or midriffs. Clothing must cover the waist, back and shoulders. (So the elegant white straples prom dress is not an option for the students.)
No bagging, sagging, or dragging clothing. Pants must be worn at the natural waist and also not touch the floor. Underwear must be covered.No clothes or jewelry that shows gang affiliation or membership. Measure for Bridesmaid Dresses

Designers usually prefer that you get measured for a bridesmaid dress in a bridal salon; however, if you cannot, at least have a friend help measure you. Measurements need to taken with the undergarments and shoes you plan to wear for the wedding. Besides that, it is imperative that you follow measuring guidelines set by designers to ensure the correct fit.
Measure your bust line in a similar fashion that you would if you were taking your bra size. Stand naturally with your feet together and your arms resting at your sides. Measure your bust at the fullest area by placing the measuring tape around the widest section of your back and the fullest part of your chest, allowing room for a thumb inside the tape.
Position the measuring tape at your natural waistline, making sure your stomach is in its proper position as well. Do not pull the measuring tape too tight, and keep a thumb in there for breathing room.
Position yourself naturally with your feet together. If your purple bridesmaid dress is going to be sheath, place the measuring tape around the fullest part of your bottom. However, if your prom dress 2012 is A-line, measure the fullest area around your hips. Again, do not pull the tape too tight.
Measure for the length of the gown by measuring is from the hollow of your neck, located by your collarbone, to your preferred hemline. Most designer attires measure 57 inches from hollow to hemline. If you are tall, 5'9 or taller and are planning to wear heels in the wedding, you should consider ordering an extra-length attire, which is 5 inches longer than a standard dress.
When you have your measurements, check the corresponding designers' size chart by calling your bridal salon. These charts indicate how the measurements correspond with the designer's sizes. If the chart puts you in one size for bust and another for hips, it is usually recommended to order the larger size, because it is easier to alter short homecoming dresses to a smaller size than to make them larger.

"We really wanted to make sure this wasn't just a fashion show," Rutledge-Borger said. "We wanted to showcase these artists as musicians."
For the National Museum of Women in the Arts, it's the first exhibit to feature women performing artists, said chief curator Kathryn Wat.
